com.st.st25sdk.command

Interface Type5CommandInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NdefType5Command, Type5Command

    public interface Type5CommandInterface
    Defines the common methods to be implemented to build Type5 commands

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte NFC_TYPE5_CMD_EXTENDED_LOCK_SINGLE_BLOCK
      Type5 Extended Lock Block command code
      static byte NFC_TYPE5_CMD_EXTENDED_READ_MULTIPLE_BLOCK
      Type5 Extended Read Multiple Block command code
      static byte NFC_TYPE5_CMD_EXTENDED_READ_SINGLE_BLOCK
      Type5 Extended Read Single Block command code
      static byte NFC_TYPE5_CMD_EXTENDED_WRITE_SINGLE_BLOCK
      Type5 Extended Write Single Block command code
      static byte NFC_TYPE5_CMD_LOCK_SINGLE_BLOCK
      Type5 Lock Single Block command code
      static byte NFC_TYPE5_CMD_READ_MULTIPLE_BLOCK
      Type5 Read Multiple Block command code
      static byte NFC_TYPE5_CMD_READ_SINGLE_BLOCK
      Type5 Read Single Block command code
      static byte NFC_TYPE5_CMD_SELECT
      Type5 Select command code
      static byte NFC_TYPE5_CMD_SLPV
      Type5 Stay Quiet command code
      static byte NFC_TYPE5_CMD_WRITE_SINGLE_BLOCK
      Type5 Write Single Block command code

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte extendedLockSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Extended Lock Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Lock the block specified by the block address of the extended memory (command code 0x32)
      byte[] extendedReadMultipleBlock(byte[] blockAddress, byte[] numberOfBlocks, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Extended Read Multiple Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Read the content of one or more blocks of the extended memory (command code 0x33)
      byte[] extendedReadSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Extended Read Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Read the content of one block of the extended memory (command code 0x30)
      byte extendedWriteSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress, byte[] buffer, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Extended Write Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Update the content of one block of the extended memory (command code 0x31)
      byte lockSingleBlock(byte blockAddress, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Lock Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Lock the block specified by the block address (command code 0x22)
      byte[] readMultipleBlock(byte blockAddress, byte numberOfBlocks, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Read Multiple Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Read the content of one or more memory blocks (command code 0x23)
      byte[] readSingleBlock(byte blockAddress, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Read Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Read the content of one memory block (command code 0x20) Uses the default flag that was set in TagCommand.setFlag() Uses the default uid that was set in TagCommand.setUid()
      byte select(byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Select command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Sets the Type 5 Tag into the Selected state (command code 0x25)
      byte stayQuiet(byte flag, byte[] uid)
      SLPV_REQ command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Sets one Type 5 Tag into the QUIET state (command code 0x02)
      byte writeSingleBlock(byte blockAddress, byte[] buffer, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Write Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Update the content of one memory block (command code 0x21)

    • Method Detail

      • readSingleBlock

        byte[] readSingleBlock(byte blockAddress,
                       byte flag,
                       byte[] uid)
                throws STException
        Read Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Read the content of one memory block (command code 0x20) Uses the default flag that was set in TagCommand.setFlag() Uses the default uid that was set in TagCommand.setUid()
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - address of the block to read
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeSingleBlock

        byte writeSingleBlock(byte blockAddress,
                      byte[] buffer,
                      byte flag,
                      byte[] uid)
               throws STException
        Write Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Update the content of one memory block (command code 0x21)
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - address of the block to write
        buffer - Data to write
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • lockSingleBlock

        byte lockSingleBlock(byte blockAddress,
                     byte flag,
                     byte[] uid)
              throws STException
        Lock Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Lock the block specified by the block address (command code 0x22)
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - address of the block to lock
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • readMultipleBlock

        byte[] readMultipleBlock(byte blockAddress,
                         byte numberOfBlocks,
                         byte flag,
                         byte[] uid)
                  throws STException
        Read Multiple Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Read the content of one or more memory blocks (command code 0x23)
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - address of the first block to read (LSByte first)
        numberOfBlocks - Number of blocks to be read minus one
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • extendedReadSingleBlock

        byte[] extendedReadSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                               byte flag,
                               byte[] uid)
                        throws STException
        Extended Read Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Read the content of one block of the extended memory (command code 0x30)
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - 2-byte address of the first block to read (LSByte first)
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • extendedWriteSingleBlock

        byte extendedWriteSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                              byte[] buffer,
                              byte flag,
                              byte[] uid)
                       throws STException
        Extended Write Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Update the content of one block of the extended memory (command code 0x31)
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - 2-byte address of the first block to read (LSByte first)
        buffer - Data to write
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • extendedLockSingleBlock

        byte extendedLockSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                             byte flag,
                             byte[] uid)
                      throws STException
        Extended Lock Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Lock the block specified by the block address of the extended memory (command code 0x32)
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - 2-byte address of the first block to read (LSByte first)
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • extendedReadMultipleBlock

        byte[] extendedReadMultipleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                                 byte[] numberOfBlocks,
                                 byte flag,
                                 byte[] uid)
                          throws STException
        Extended Read Multiple Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Read the content of one or more blocks of the extended memory (command code 0x33)
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - 2-byte address of the first block to read (LSByte first)
        numberOfBlocks - 2-byte Number of blocks to be read minus one
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • select

        byte select(byte flag,
            byte[] uid)
     throws STException
        Select command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Sets the Type 5 Tag into the Selected state (command code 0x25)
        Parameters:
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte response for status
        Throws:
        STException

      • stayQuiet

        byte stayQuiet(byte flag,
               byte[] uid)
        throws STException
        SLPV_REQ command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification Sets one Type 5 Tag into the QUIET state (command code 0x02)
        Parameters:
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte response for status
        Throws:
        STException
